required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase III Study of BAY43-9006 in Patients With Advanced Hepatocellular Carcinoma (HCC) Treated After Transcatheter Arterial Chemoembolization (TACE)
clinical_study.official_title: Phase III Study of BAY43-9006 in Patients With Advanced Hepatocellular Carcinoma (HCC) Treated After Transcatheter Arterial Chemoembolization (TACE)

brief_summary.textblock: Clinical trial of BAY43-9006 in patients with hepatocellular carcinoma.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization of the first subject until radiological progression or recurrence whichever came first, assessed up to 39 months.
primary_outcome.description: Time to progression (TTP) was defined as the time from date of randomization to radiological progression / recurrence. Subjects without progression at the time of analysis were censored at their last date of tumor evaluation.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization of the first subject until 39 months later.
secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival (OS) was defined as the time from date of randomization to death due to any cause. Subjects still alive at their last date of follow-up were censored at the time of analysis.

arm_group.description: Sorafenib (Nexavar, BAY43-9006) administered orally at a dose of 400 mg (2 x 200 mg tablets) twice daily (bid) (morning and evening, every 12 hours as far as possible); Dose modification (delayed or reduced) was permitted due to toxicity.
Sorafenib (Nexavar, BAY43-9006) matching placebo (2 placebo tablets) orally administered bid (twice daily).

intervention.description: Multikinase Inhibitor; Sorafenib: 400mg bid of sorafenib

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female
- Aged of 18 and over
- Advanced hepatocellular carcinoma
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of prior systemic chemotherapy
- Failure in vital organ

link.description: Click here and search for drug information provided by the FDA.
Click here and search for information on any recalls, market or product safety alerts by the FDA which might have occurred with this product.

results_reference.citation: Kudo M, Imanaka K, Chida N, Nakachi K, Tak WY, Takayama T, Yoon JH, Hori T, Kumada H, Hayashi N, Kaneko S, Tsubouchi H, Suh DJ, Furuse J, Okusaka T, Tanaka K, Matsui O, Wada M, Yamaguchi I, Ohya T, Meinhardt G, Okita K. Phase III study of sorafenib after transarterial chemoembolisation in Japanese and Korean patients with unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma. Eur J Cancer. 2011 Sep;47(14):2117-27. doi: 10.1016/j.ejca.2011.05.007.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The first subject was enrolled on 27 Aug 2006. The final data collection date for the primary endpoint analysis was 10 Jul 2009. The study was conducted at 77 centers from 2 countries: Korea (7 centers) and Japan (70). 76 centers enrolled at least 1 subject (7 centers in Korea and 69 in Japan). The last subject's last visit occurred on 19 Nov 2010.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of 552 subjects screened, 458 were randomized and were valid for the efficacy analyses (intent to treat [ITT] population), and 456 received at least 1 dose of study drug and were valid for the safety analyses. 229 subjects were randomized to each group (sorafenib or placebo).

group.title: Sorafenib (Nexavar, BAY43-9006)
group.description: Sorafenib (Nexavar, BAY43-9006) administered orally at a dose of 400 mg (2 x 200 mg tablets) twice daily (bid) (morning and evening, every 12 hours as far as possible); Dose modification (delayed or reduced) was permitted due to toxicity.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Sorafenib (Nexavar, BAY43-9006) matching placebo (2 placebo tablets) orally administered bid (twice daily).

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Participant Did Not Take Study Drug

group.title: Sorafenib (Nexavar, BAY43-9006)
group.description: Sorafenib (Nexavar, BAY43-9006) administered orally at a dose of 400 mg (2 x 200 mg tablets) twice daily (bid) (morning and evening, every 12 hours as far as possible); Dose modification (delayed or reduced) was permitted due to toxicity.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Sorafenib (Nexavar, BAY43-9006) matching placebo (2 placebo tablets) orally administered bid (twice daily).

measure.title: Child Pugh Status
measure.description: A Child-Pugh (CP) score (determined by encephalopathy grade, ascites, serum bilirubin and albumin, prothrombin time) is used to assess the prognosis of chronic liver disease, mainly cirrhosis. One of the inclusion criterion for this study was a CP class A (good operative risk); class B (moderate risk) score or class C (poor operative risk) was excluded.

measure.title: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status
measure.description: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) Performance Status is a scale that measures how cancer affects a patient. 0 = fully active, 1 = restricted strenuous activity, 2 = ambulatory, 3 = limited selfcare, 4 = completely disabled, 5 = dead. Subjects entering this study must have had an ECOG score of 0 or 1.

measure.title: Responder group to transcatheter arterial chemoembolization (TACE)
measure.description: Responder Group A: percentage of tumor necrosis or tumor shrinkage is 100 percentage. Responder Group B: percentage of tumor necrosis or tumor shrinkage is 25 percentage or more to less than 100 percentage. Subjects entering this study is a responder to TACE.

measure.title: Number of Prior transcatheter arterial chemoembolization (TACE)
measure.description: Subjects entering this study must have had previous TACE at a maximum of 2 times.

outcome.title: Time to Progression (TTP)
outcome.description: Time to progression (TTP) was defined as the time from date of randomization to radiological progression / recurrence. Subjects without progression at the time of analysis were censored at their last date of tumor evaluation.
outcome.time_frame: From randomization of the first subject until radiological progression or recurrence whichever came first, assessed up to 39 months.

group.title: Sorafenib (Nexavar, BAY43-9006)
group.description: Sorafenib (Nexavar, BAY43-9006) administered orally at a dose of 400 mg (2 x 200 mg tablets) twice daily (bid) (morning and evening, every 12 hours as far as possible); Dose modification (delayed or reduced) was permitted due to toxicity.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Sorafenib (Nexavar, BAY43-9006) matching placebo (2 placebo tablets) orally administered bid (twice daily).

measure.title: Time to Progression (TTP)
measure.description: Time to progression (TTP) was defined as the time from date of randomization to radiological progression / recurrence. Subjects without progression at the time of analysis were censored at their last date of tumor evaluation.

analysis.estimate_desc: The comparison between the 2 groups is done using the log rank test stratified by the response of TACE (Responder group A versus Responder group B), ECOG performance status (PS) (0 versus 1) and the number of prior TACE (1 versus 2).

outcome.title: Overall Survival (OS)
outcome.description: Overall survival (OS) was defined as the time from date of randomization to death due to any cause. Subjects still alive at their last date of follow-up were censored at the time of analysis.
outcome.time_frame: From randomization of the first subject until 39 months later.
outcome.population: Median overall survival (OS) and 95% Confidence interval (CI) were not estimable in Placebo Group and Upper Limit of 95% CI was not in Sorafenib Group because of more than half (188 for Placebo,186 for Sorafenib) of the individual study populations censored. Number of death is shown in "Post-Hoc Outcome Measure".

outcome.title: Number of Death Cases Due to Any Cause
outcome.time_frame: From randomization of the first subject until death due to any cause assessed up to 55 months.
outcome.population: Intention to treat (ITT) population. "Overall Survival" is shown in "Secondary Outcome Measure: Overall Survival".

reported_events.desc: Acronyms in Adverse Event section: - Absolute Neutrophil Count (ANC) - Alanine Transaminase (ALT) - Aspartate Transaminase (AST) - Atrioventricular (AV) - Central Nervous System (CNS) - Gastrointestinal (GI) - International Normalized Ratio (INR) - Not Otherwise Specified (NOS)

event.sub_title: CONDUCTION ABNORMALITY, AV BLOCK-3RD DEGREE (COMPLETE AV BLOCK)
INFECTION WITH NORMAL ANC, BILIARY TREE

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
